glossentry.glossdef:
A software provider can be the manufacturer itself or a software distributor. In most cases, the offered software is a mixed form. This means that the manufacturer's own and third-party components are combined. In the context of a supply chain for software, the provider and the recipient represent a link in this chain. A provider, who produces software on the basis of third-party content and uses it to implement projects or products (provider), is also a recipient in the supply chain and is dependent on supplies from other providers (supplier).
